story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: david_vs_goliath
primary_trope.hook_text: This Solid race beats half the Elite tier.
primary_trope.mechanism: Loss aversion — framing around what elite races LACK that this underdog HAS.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Gravel Suisse? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Gravel Suisse scored 53 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Gravel Suisse. Aigle, Switzerland. 65 mi. Swiss Alpine gravel.
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Time to break down the scorecard. Elevation. 4 out of 5. Your power-to-weight ratio matters here. The Summit route delivers 3,300m+ of climbing over 100km from Aigle to Col de la Croix. Adventure. 4 out of 5. Serious exploration vibes. Far from pavement. The course travels "from the World Cycling Center in Aigle to the heights of Villars" through terrain described as "wild, demanding and infinitely alpine. Experience. 4 out of 5. Special. This race sticks with you. Length. 3 out of 5. The Goldilocks zone of suffering. Andreas Seewald won the 2025 men's race in 3:37:47 as "the five climbs shattered the field. Climate. 3 out of 5. Variable. Bring layers and a flexible attitude. Historical weather data shows average highs of 78°F and lows of 60°F, with a 58% chance of rain on any given day. Altitude. 3 out of 5. You'll feel it on the climbs. Starting from Aigle at 380m, the Gran Fondo route climbs to 1,819m at its highest point 11km before the finish. Community. 3 out of 5. Good vibes. Riders actually talk to each other. The race debuted in 2024 at "the doorsteps of the UCI headquarters in Aigle" with special significance in gravel racing. Logistics. 2 out of 5. You'll figure it out. Eventually. The race starts at UCI headquarters in Aigle with 550+ riders annually, now awarded 2029 UCI Gravel World Championships.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest, in rapid succession. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Some chunky bits. Nothing catastrophic. Prestige. 2 out of 5. Building a name. Not there yet. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Adequate. Room for improvement. Field Depth. 2 out of 5. Modest field. Some fast riders in the mix. Value. 2 out of 5. Value is not the strong suit. Expenses. 1 out of 5. Premium pricing. Everything costs more here.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment
beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.narration: Travel, lodging, and the unsexy details.
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Fly into: Geneva 1.5 hours or Zurich 3 hours
Lodging: Aigle has moderate lodging options. Switzerland is expensive.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Swiss Alpine Gravel. If you're in Europe and have a good budget. yes, the Alps are worth it. If you're international or budget-conscious. there are better options.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Gravel Suisse isn't quite right for you. For better value: French/Italian Alps races. For similar Alpine terrain: Austrian gravel races.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced Gravel Suisse? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.

meme_inserts.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

thumbnail_prompt: South Park style flat cutout character, boxing stance, David vs Goliath framing, 'Gravel Suisse' bold text, tier badge 'SOLID', high contrast red/yellow/white, cycling gear, handlebar mustache --ar 16:9 --cref [CHARACTER_URL]

cross_platform_notes.youtube: Primary platform. SEO-optimize title for '[Race Name] review'.
cross_platform_notes.extract_shorts: Pull 3-5 Shorts: hook, biggest surprise score, verdict.
cross_platform_notes.blog: Cross-reference the race profile page for search traffic.
